alert.note: Alert for Dearborn; Franklin; Ripley (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 23 at 6:09PM EDT until July 23 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wilmington has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Western Franklin County in southeastern Indiana... Northeastern Ripley County in southeastern Indiana... Northwestern Dearborn County in southeastern Indiana... * Until 700 PM EDT. * At 609 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Oldenburg, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Batesville, Oldenburg, Lake Santee, Sunman, Laurel, Huntersville, Hamburg, Ballstown, Penntown, Weisburg, Interstate 74 at State Route 101, Peppertown, Lawrenceville and Buena Vista. This includes I-74 in Indiana between mile markers 145 and 159. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
